title: (x) Todos A La Plaza El 26 - Profil (Decorated 35) {Karl, Mike Y}
content:
Anybody knows what font is that one represented in this late 60's cuban poster?   
   
thanks ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081117194719im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/68408.jpg)

 [‹ (x) Crown Gasoline - Adobe Serif substitution font {Yves}](http://web.archive.org/web/20081117194719/http:/www.typophile.com/node/10049 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) David Beckham Calendar type - Tension {Sander} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081117194719/http:/www.typophile.com/node/9973 "Go to next forum topic")
author: luis_maiq

comments.content:
Which one (as there are 3 elements of text)?   
Although I presume you mean the big "26", right?
I swear it starts with the letter V
yeah... the big 26 and "todos a la plaza el"
I do that all the time. I was sure this typeface started with a C. After a while all the names start to blend together, or maybe that's just my problem.
Yeah. Might as well have all typefaces with the same name. ehehe. j/k

The non-Bitstream name for this is 'Profil' by Eugen & Max Lenz (1946), so this has been around a long time (it's two years younger than I am ![:-(](http://web.archive.org/web/20081117194719im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/sad.gif) )

Tiff, you meant [Vineta](http://web.archive.org/web/20081117194719/http:/www.fontshop.com/?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&searchby=manufacturer&displayfontid=BT.107824.0.1). It's not slanted, includes a lowercase and   
has no negative outline, but looks very similar to the untrained eye...   
   
   
   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081117194719im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/bigsmile.gif) ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081117194719im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/bigsmile.gif) ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081117194719im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/bigsmile.gif)
ahaha! yes. oh dear. so much for my rep. thanks, yves! ;^P
